intro: Centaurea bavegehensis, commonly known as the Bavegeh thistle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by spiny bracts, a feature common in many thistle species. Centaurea bavegehensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native ecosystem.
